issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The problem described is an issue which will never be fixed.
resolution.name: Won't Fix

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
While uploading an image, I accidentally provided an invalid Kernel and Ramdisk IDs (they didn't exist). See the images description below. This prevented me from launching the instance obviously. The Question is should the tools prevent a user from uploading an image with an invalid Kernel/Ramdisk ID?

[root@eucahost-51-93 alice]# euca-describe-images
IMAGE	emi-404837AC	centos_5_3_generic_image/centos.5-3.x86-64.img.manifest.xml	135765689566	available	public		i386	machine	eki-EF503754	eri-A495398E		instance-store
IMAGE	eki-B6CD3B77	centos_5_3_xen_kernel/vmlinuz-2.6.27.21-0.1-xen.manifest.xml	135765689566	available	public		i386	kernel				instance-store
IMAGE	eri-79E43869	centos_5_3_generic_ramdisk/initrd.img-2.6.28-11-generic.manifest.xml	135765689566	available	public		i386	ramdisk				instance-store
IMAGE	eki-234A38D5	centos_5_3_generic_kernel/vmlinuz-2.6.28-11-generic.manifest.xml	135765689566	available	public		i386	kernel				instance-store
IMAGE	emi-969D3A8B	centos_5_3_xen_image/centos.5-3.x86-64.img.manifest.xml	135765689566	available	public		i386	machine	eki-93593B50	eri-C2A238B4		instance-store
IMAGE	eri-E61B36CA	centos_5_3_xen_ramdisk/initrd-2.6.27.21-0.1-xen.manifest.xml	135765689566	available	public		i386	ramdisk				instance-store
[root@eucahost-51-93 alice]# euca-run-instances emi-969D3A8B -k alice.private 
RunInstancesType: Failed to lookup kernel image information eki-93593B50 because of: Failed to lookup image: eki-93593B50 because of example: [KernelImageInfo manifestLocation=null signature=null checksum=null checksumType=null bundleSizeBytes=null imageName=null description=null architecture=null imagePublic=null platform=null imageType=kernel permissions=[] productCodes=[] deviceMappings=[] imageSizeBytes=null fullName=null ownerUserId=null ownerUserName=null ownerAccountNumber=null ownerAccountName=null uniqueName=null ownerFullNameCached=null state=null lastState=null stateChangeStack=null displayName=eki-93593B50 id=null version=null creationTimestamp=null lastUpdateTimestamp=null naturalId=null]
[root@eucahost-51-93 alice]# euca-run-instances emi-404837AC -k alice.private 
RunInstancesType: Failed to lookup kernel image information eki-EF503754 because of: Failed to lookup image: eki-EF503754 because of example: [KernelImageInfo manifestLocation=null signature=null checksum=null checksumType=null bundleSizeBytes=null imageName=null description=null architecture=null imagePublic=null platform=null imageType=kernel permissions=[] productCodes=[] deviceMappings=[] imageSizeBytes=null fullName=null ownerUserId=null ownerUserName=null ownerAccountNumber=null ownerAccountName=null uniqueName=null ownerFullNameCached=null state=null lastState=null stateChangeStack=null displayName=eki-EF503754 id=null version=null creationTimestamp=null lastUpdateTimestamp=null naturalId=null]
[root@eucahost-51-93 alice]#
fields.summary: Should user be able to upload/register an image with an invalid kernel/ramdisk?

comments.body:
Here's the list of commands and output I entered to get into this state:
-----

[root@eucahost-51-93 alice]# tar zxvf euca-centos-5.3-x86_64.tar.gz 
euca-centos-5.3-x86_64/
euca-centos-5.3-x86_64/centos.5-3.x86-64.img
euca-centos-5.3-x86_64/xen-kernel/
euca-centos-5.3-x86_64/xen-kernel/vmlinuz-2.6.27.21-0.1-xen
euca-centos-5.3-x86_64/xen-kernel/initrd-2.6.27.21-0.1-xen
euca-centos-5.3-x86_64/kvm-kernel/
euca-centos-5.3-x86_64/kvm-kernel/vmlinuz-2.6.28-11-generic
euca-centos-5.3-x86_64/kvm-kernel/initrd.img-2.6.28-11-generic
[root@eucahost-51-93 alice]# euca-bundle-image -i euca-centos-5.3-x86_64/xen-kernel/vmlinuz-2.6.27.21-0.1-xen --kernel true
Checking image
Encrypting image
Splitting image...
Part: vmlinuz-2.6.27.21-0.1-xen.part.00
Generating manifest /tmp/vmlinuz-2.6.27.21-0.1-xen.manifest.xml
[root@eucahost-51-93 alice]# euca-upload-bundle -b centos_5_3_xen_kernel -m /tmp/vmlinuz-2.6.27.21-0.1-xen.manifest.xml
Checking bucket: centos_5_3_xen_kernel
Creating bucket: centos_5_3_xen_kernel
Uploading manifest file
Uploading part: vmlinuz-2.6.27.21-0.1-xen.part.00
Uploaded image as centos_5_3_xen_kernel/vmlinuz-2.6.27.21-0.1-xen.manifest.xml
[root@eucahost-51-93 alice]# euca-register centos_5_3_xen_kernel/vmlinuz-2.6.27.21-0.1-xen.manifest.xml
IMAGE	eki-B6CD3B77
[root@eucahost-51-93 alice]# euca-bundle-image -i euca-centos-5.3-x86_64/xen-kernel/initrd-2.6.27.21-0.1-xen --ramdisk true

IMAGE	eri-E61B36CA
[root@eucahost-51-93 alice]# euca-bundle-image -i euca-centos-5.3-x86_64/centos.5-3.x86-64.img --kernel eki-93593B50 --ramdisk eri-C2A238B4

register should fail for an image if the kernel/ramdisk ID are invalid.
